block.p: Stanford beat Clemson by 10-4 yesterday, sending the Tigers into the losers' bracket at the College World Series in Omaha. Justin Wayne (15-3), the fifth overall pick in last week's amateur draft by the Montreal Expos, scattered eight hits over seven and two-thirds innings.

Stanford beat Clemson by 10-4 yesterday, sending the Tigers into the losers' bracket at the College World Series in Omaha. Justin Wayne (15-3), the fifth overall pick in last week's amateur draft by the Montreal Expos, scattered eight hits over seven and two-thirds innings.

Stanford gets to rest until Wednesday. The Cardinal (49-15) will face whichever team comes out of the losers' side of the bracket. Clemson (51-17) plays tomorrow against Louisiana-Lafayette, which eliminated San Jose State by 6-3 last night.
